actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to establish a Continuing Disability Review Account in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund which shall be available solely for expenditures necessary to carry out continuing disability reviews.
short_title: Social Security Continuing Disability Review Account Act of 1995
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Continuing Disability Review Account Act of 1995 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to create in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund a Continuing Disability Review Account as a mechanism for funding continuing disability reviews (CDRs) out of a portion of the savings derived from conducting such reviews. Requires Account operations to be reflected in the Secretary of Health and Human Services' annual report to the Congress on CDRs.

titles.title: Social Security Continuing Disability Review Account Act of 1995

To amend title II of the Social Security Act to establish a Continuing Disability Review Account in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund which shall be available solely for expenditures necessary to carry out continuing disability reviews.
